title: How to Make and Use Friendship Bread

steps.headline: Pour the warm water into a bowl.
steps.description: Add the active dry yeast into the bowl and let the yeast dissolve for about 10 minutes. Stir the mixture well.

steps.headline: Get a plastic or glass container and mix the flour and sugar together.
Add the milk and yeast mixture to the container slowly while stirring everything together.
Wrap the container with plastic wrap.
Mark this mixture as "Day 1".
steps.description: Follow the calendar for each day's instructions.

steps.headline: Get a bowl and combine the baking powder, baking soda, oil, salt, eggs, sugar, flour, vanilla, and cinnamon with a fork.
steps.description: Mix this until it's well combined and blended together.

steps.headline: Add your section of the 10-day mixture into this.
Use butter to grease two loaf pans.
steps.description: Instead of flouring the bottom of the pans, use sugar.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the pans evenly.
steps.description: Bake at 325 degrees F (163 degrees C or gas mark 3) for about 45 to 60 minutes.

steps.headline: Leave it to cool for 10 minutes before removing the loaves from the pans.

text: Bread Starter Recipe Pour the warm water into a bowl. Add the active dry yeast into the bowl and let the yeast dissolve for about 10 minutes. Stir the mixture well. Get a plastic or glass container and mix the flour and sugar together.  Add the milk and yeast mixture to the container slowly while stirring everything together.  Wrap the container with plastic wrap.  Mark this mixture as "Day 1". Follow the calendar for each day's instructions. Bread Recipe Get a bowl and combine the baking powder, baking soda, oil, salt, eggs, sugar, flour, vanilla, and cinnamon with a fork. Mix this until it's well combined and blended together. Add your section of the 10-day mixture into this. Mix thoroughly. Use butter to grease two loaf pans. Instead of flouring the bottom of the pans, use sugar. Pour the mixture into the pans evenly. Bake at 325 degrees F (163 degrees C or gas mark 3) for about 45 to 60 minutes. Leave it to cool for 10 minutes before removing the loaves from the pans.
